channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- watchOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- watchOS

item.title: CVE-2023-32417|2024-08-02T15:18:36.837Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: This issue was addressed by restricting options offered on a locked device. This issue is fixed in watchOS 9.5. An attacker with physical access to a locked Apple Watch may be able to view user photos or contacts via accessibility features.

item.title: CVE-2023-32354|2024-08-02T15:10:25.032Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in watchOS 9.5, tvOS 16.5, iOS 16.5 and iPadOS 16.5. An app may be able to disclose kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2023-32425|2024-08-02T15:18:36.889Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.5 and iPadOS 16.5, watchOS 9.5. An app may be able to gain elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27814|2024-06-11T19:06:32.639Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in watchOS 10.5. A person with physical access to a device may be able to view contact information from the lock screen.

item.title: CVE-2024-27814|2024-08-02T00:41:55.425Z -- apple -- watchos
item.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in watchOS 10.5. A person with physical access to a device may be able to view contact information from the lock screen.
